intro: Trachyandra glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular trachyandra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Trachyandra glandulosa is noted for its resilience and ability to survive in harsh climatic conditions.
